A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It was a great movie. However\, the first 10 mins were absolute bs. I almost started screaming\, it was that bad. But overall I really enjoyed this movie. It was extremely overwhelming\, and not meant at all for anyone who hasn’t seen TFA. The effects were top notch. Character development wasn’t too terrible\, but wasn’t amazing. (Spoiler) The way they introduced some characters and then killed them off after you make a connection to them felt wrong. Snoke was.... idk but that whole thing was odd. And he was wayyy too OP to not have some sort of background info on. This movie\, at many points in it\, could’ve completely ended the entire series and been left at that. And while you’re watching the movie\, it feels like the third in the trilogy\, but it only makes sense afterwards that it belongs in the middle. This movie will be debated about for years. (MAJOR SPOILER) At the end when it said “In loving memory of our Princess\, Carrie Fisher” I burst into tears. I think she would’ve loved this movie.
